Bash(/tmp/f0.5-conventions-outline.txt << 'EOF'
# F0.5 Conventions Outline \(from ADR-003\)

## Extracted Sections

### 1. ARTIFACT LOCATIONS \(lines 178-203 of ADR-003\)
Directory structure for E3+ epics:
- work/epics/eN-{name}/scope.md ← /rai-epic-design
- work/epics/eN-{name}/plan.md ← /rai-epic-plan
- work/epics/eN-{name}/stories/fN.M-{name}/scope.md ← /rai-story-start
- work/epics/eN-{name}/stories/fN.M-{name}/design.md ← /rai-story-design
- work/epics/eN-{name}/stories/fN.M-{name}/plan.md ← /rai-story-plan
- work/epics/eN-{name}/stories/fN.M-{name}/progress.md ← /rai-story-implement
- work/epics/eN-{name}/stories/fN.M-{name}/retrospective.md ← /rai-story-review
- work/epics/eN-{name}/research.md ← /rai-research \(optional\)
- work/epics/eN-{name}/retrospective.md ← /rai-epic-close

### 2. SKILL-TO-ARTIFACT MAPPING \(from ADR-003 Rationale section\)
| Skill | Output | Purpose |
| /rai-epic-design | scope.md | Features, dependencies, ADRs |
| /rai-epic-plan | plan.md | Sequencing, milestones, risks |
| /rai-story-design | design.md | Approach, examples, acceptance |
| /rai-story-plan | plan.md | Tasks, verification, order |
| /rai-story-implement | progress.md | Task log, completion gates |
| /rai-story-review | retrospective.md | Learnings, patterns, improvements |
| /rai-epic-close | retrospective.md | Epic metrics, retro, merge |

### 3. NAVIGATION QUESTIONS \(inferred from ADR-003\)
Q1: "Where do I find the feature requirements?" → design.md \(approach, examples, acceptance\)
Q2: "What are the architectural decisions?" → scope.md \(ADRs section\)
Q3: "What tasks make up this feature?" → plan.md \(task breakdown\)
Q4: "What did we learn from this epic?" → retrospective.md \(learnings\)

### 4. KEY CONSTRAINTS \(from ADR-003\)
- specs/ becomes historical archive \(E1 only, no new content after E0\)
- work/epics/eN/ is canonical location for E3+
- All artifacts use YAML frontmatter + markdown
- Single pipeline: RaiSE skills handle design AND execution
- No dual systems \(spec-kit vs RaiSE\) — RaiSE subsumes spec-kit

### 5. WHY THIS STRUCTURE \(from ADR-003 Rationale\)
- Single pipeline \(design → execution in same tree\)
- One navigation tree \(all in work/\)
- Consistent structure \(YAML + markdown\)
- Continuous improvement \(retrospectives feed memory\)
- Simplicity \(RAI-VAL-2: one system, not two\)

## Outline for work/CONVENTION-design.md

1. Title & Purpose
2. Artifact Locations \(directory diagram\)
3. Lifecycle Mapping \(table: phase → skill → artifact\)
4. Navigation Guide \(answers 4 key questions\)
5. Why This Structure \(simplicity, single pipeline\)
6. Historical Note \(specs/ = E1 archive, work/ = E3+ active\)
7. References \(ADR-001, ADR-002, ADR-003\)

EOF)

Bash(/tmp/BRANCHING-POLICY.md << 'EOF'
# Branching Policy — carbtrack-ai \(Hybrid RaiSE Model\)

## Branch Structure

```
main \(stable, merged epics only\)
  ↑
  └── origin/epic/eN-{name} \(WIP, all features in progress\)
       ├── F0.1-xxx \(scope commit\)
       ├── F0.2-xxx \(scope commit\)
       └── FN.M-xxx \(scope commit\) ← Latest feature
```

## Push Timing

### During Epic Development
- **When:** Each feature completed \(F0.x → retrospective done\)
- **What:** Push to `origin/epic/eN-{name}` \(NOT main\)
- **Purpose:** Real-time backup, team visibility, WIP tracking

### Epic Closure
- **When:** All features complete, epic tested, retrospective done
- **What:** `/rai-epic-close` merges `epic/eN/...` → `main` and pushes
- **Purpose:** Atomic update to stable main, feature complete

## Branch Semantics

| Branch | Meaning | Update Frequency |
|--------|---------|------------------|
| `main` | Stable, merged epics only | Rarely \(at epic closure\) |
| `origin/epic/eN/...` | WIP epic, features in progress | Frequently \(per feature\) |
| Local `epic/eN/...` | Current development branch | Continuous \(per task\) |

## Collaboration Signals

- **"I see `epic/e0/...` in GitHub"** → E0 is in progress, watching for closure
- **"PRs should only target main"** → Never merge epic branches to main directly; use `/rai-epic-close`
- **"`main` has new commits"** → An epic just closed and merged

## Key Principle

**Hybrid approach = Push progress, merge discipline**
- Push frequently \(WIP visible, backed up\)
- Merge rarely \(only at epic closure, through `/rai-epic-close`\)
EOF)

Bash(/tmp/f0-6-scope.txt << 'EOF'
feat\(F0.6\): initialize parking lot story

## Feature Scope: F0.6 — Initialize Parking Lot

**In Scope:**
- Create `dev/parking-lot.md` with standard format
- Document deferred items from E0 \(known gaps, nice-to-haves\)
- Document pending items from framework \(process improvements, calibration\)
- Include: item, reason for deferral, suggested resolution timeframe

**Out of Scope:**
- Implementing deferred items \(future work\)
- Comprehensive backlog grooming \(scope: E0 deferreds only\)
- Creating additional tracking structures

**Done Criteria:**
- [ ] `dev/parking-lot.md` created with clear format
- [ ] At least 3-5 deferred items from E0 documented
- [ ] Each item has rationale and timeframe
- [ ] File is readable \(Shu-level clarity\)
- [ ] Retrospective complete

Co-Authored-By: Rai <rai@humansys.ai>
EOF)
